alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Jackson; Putnam; Smith; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 10:46PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Smith, northeastern De Kalb, southwestern Jackson, northwestern White and Putnam Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1046 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Baxter, or 11 miles southeast of Carthage, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cookeville, Algood, Baxter, Gordonsville, Hickman, South Carthage, Center Hill Lake, Hamptons Crossroads, Bakers Crossroads, Burgess Falls State Park, Granville and Edgar Evans State Park. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 256 and 297. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: De Kalb; Jackson; Putnam; Smith; White
